title: Stopped working with Apple Watch
text: I used to be able to approve sign-ins on my Apple Watch but now the app on the watch says I must first add a Microsoft account on my iPhone. I have almost every Microsoft program running on my iPhone, and the Microsoft Authenticator app is set up with my Microsoft account already. I can approve sign-ins on my iPhone, but not on the watch. I don’t know why it stopped working, but it’s really convenient to use my watch if I don’t have my phone right next to me. I hope they get this worked out.

title: Y’all broke your Apple Watch support
text:
The app has been fine for the most part.  Sometimes a notification fails, or after getting a notification an authentication request fails with an unhelpful error message, but for the love of god y’all broke the best thing about this app!

Previously users could authenticate their sessions with the Apple Watch!  Meaning I didn’t have to dig my phone out of my purse or grab it off of the charger, I could just do the entire authentication with my Apple Watch.  Now the watch app is useless, it just tells me there is an Authenticator notification, but I can’t do anything with it but dismiss it.

This is a garbage move and makes me never want to use this again.  Please upgrade your apps rather than downgrade them.

title: Could we get codes on the watch?
text:
Microsoft Authenticator is an amazing app, works perfectly for me and I love how I can use passwordless sign-in for my Microsoft account. Super convenient with an Apple Watch. One thing I wish was added though is the ability to generate 2FA codes with the Apple Watch app. I know some other 2FA apps can do this so I’d love it if it would be added to MS Auth. That would make this app a 5/5. 

Also, to the person who is upset that codes are now hidden by default: you can change that. Tap the three lines in the top left and then just tap “Show codes”. Voila. Codes are back.

title: Doesn’t work
text: One would think Microsoft would fix the Authenticator issue after being sued for locking people out of their accounts. The suit was called Schlacter v. Microsoft. Anyway, have been locked out of 365 for 3 week thanks to this app. Customer services is completely incompetent. Starting to doubt there is even a “data protection team”. I was told there person assigned to my ticket had “absconded” (um  okay???) Have asked to escalate my issue after 15 or so calls and got hung up on. Convinced if they can’t help you, they just hang up. Not sure what’s next, as you keep charging my account. The level of absurdity is beyond comprehension. I guess I’ll just continue to be locked out of my business account and let you keep charging it.

title: This current version
text: This version with the numbers to verify my Microsoft email account is not working correctly. It’s just two numbers that it gives you to type in on your phone, but I nearly went crazy when it kept saying that the numbers didn’t match five times in a row. To the point I was triple-checking two digits! Something isn’t right and the Face ID is plenty secure for me, I DO NOT need additional numbers to match, that’s annoying, and when it doesn’t work, it’s so annoying that it prompted me to leave this review. I typically never review things and this is the first negative review I have left in years. Please fix this. It’s otherwise a great app!

title: Great But
text:
Love it for how it works as a remote Authenticator for OneDrive & Outlook, and especially for work to authenticate with TouchID when logging in to work resources. 

BUT - really frustrated by how you lose 2 factor or step linkage to services when you have to restore your iPhone (either from having to erase or moving to a new iPhone) and now I’ve lost login access to some services I used it with for 2 factor. One in particular doesn’t even offer email temporary recovery so I have to completely wipe my settings and information to re-establish access.

title: Only putting five stars to get noticed…
text: I’m a college student who needs to get into my canvas account in order to do that I need to log into my Microsoft usually this app never gave me problems. But now no number pops up and I’m stuck. I’ve contacted my school but they’re no help either and they say it’s a Microsoft malfunction there’s literally no support number or email where I can reach out to you and I’m very disappointed because it’s obviously an account that I need to use.

title: Removing Apple Watch Support Has Made Made This So Much Worse
text: I try to not write reviews on apps that aren’t positive, but the removal of the Apple Watch app support for Authenticator has made this app more cumbersome and irritating. Being able to simply tap to authenticate when the notification came through on my bio authenticated watch was such a boon to our day to day workflow. Now I have to completely stop what I’m doing to pick up my phone, unlock my phone, hit yes, and then double Face ID to get into the app to do the simplest of things at work. Working in the tech sector, I am familiar enough with cybersecurity to know that whatever gains you think were made by removing the app are only hindering those who have to use this app daily.

title: Not syncing with watch app
text: I’ve installed and reinstalled the watch app a number of times and it still doesn’t sync with the phone app. In fact it it doesn’t see to recognize the phone app at all. What little help I’ve found on the web did not answer my question. It asked me to set up my two MS accounts and that’s as far as it got. I have about 20 non MS accounts that work fine in the phone app but don’t show up in the watch app.

title: Just the worst Authenticator
text:
The app never makes a noise to notify me when I need to authenticate. I sign into my account and have to turn my eyes to the Authenticator to watch it and wait for a change to my Lock Screen to I can finish the MFA.

The worst part is that sometimes the push notification doesn’t even happen.  Sometimes I have to just manually open the Authenticator when I know I SHOULD have received a request to sign in.  Once inside the app I can approve the request, but then two or three minutes after I approve the request to sign in … TA-DA! Authenticator finally sends a push notification telling me to approve a request to sign in.  

This is the worst Authenticator app i have ever used.  It is very annoying.

title: This app is a scam to download.
text:
Multiple login issues when it comes to using the Authenticator. I have terrible memory so every time I would login I would have to change my password but when I heard of this app it did help one time hit after that it’s sent me an error message about not being able to login, I can login into my Authenticator app with my Face ID which I’m thankful for but why would the app not work? Is it not the sole purpose for when I forget my Microsoft password? The error message is just an extra step to me having to take for me forgetting my password. 
I see no purpose in using it anymore just thought I’d share my feelings towards it since I am one of the ones with short term memory!!

title: Hacked crypto stolen
text: Sim swapped someone was able to reset Microsoft Authenticator password and then was able to change all my passwords.  They stole $6,000 of my bitcoin from Coinbase and even withdrew $1,000 from my bank.  I had no phone service for 20 minutes , by the time I was able to log back in everything was stolen.  Microsoft Authenticator only made the hackers job easier as they were getting my text message authentication codes to change the passwords.  Beware of this app it does nothing.  Shame on Microsoft,  Coinbase says my problem for not protecting my passwords and T mobile said they are investigating.  Doesn’t seem right someone can change all your passwords and then liquidate your bitcoins and nobody will help me.

title: Wanted it to work but...
text:
I set it up on my iPhone, and wanted to be able to also use on my iPad.  I could find no instructions on how to pull my info that I entered on the iPhone into the app on the iPad.  There is no recovery option on my iPad app, only the iPhone app.  There should be a way and I am sure there is, it is just not answered in any FAQ I saw.   
Most apps when you set them up on multiple devices you use and sign in, all your stored info is there.  Not here and once something gets this complicated I lose interest.  So I will try other apps to see if any work across all my devices.  I should not have to have separate accounts or re set up all my accounts each time I go to another device.

title: Double-edged Sword
text: Made the critical mistake of not calling Microsoft and asking them permission to buy a new phone. Oops. Now Authenticator won’t work on new phone. Completely locked out. Called Microsoft and was on the phone for over an hour. They finally reset the Authenticator for me, but there are no work around. No other options. Be VERY careful or you could lose your emails. The guy on the phone even asked me if I can just forward the emails I need into my gmail account and he would reset the email. Um, first of all, I can’t sign in to that email which I why I called, and second, no F thank you!  I pay for this email account. It’s not attached to any business. If they can’t find an easier way to authorize your account, I’m out;  gmail it is. (which is total crap).

title: Works great when it works
text:
Got a new phone. iCloud backup recovery didn’t restore this app fully. All good, but when I go to restore from Microsoft backup it tells me I’ve tried to log in too many times and to try again tomorrow. Uhm… first of all, no I haven’t and second, F you very much. And when I try to use my Microsoft security key (backup option for recovery) to gain access again, it tells me I have to wait 30 days!! 
Microsoft, security is one thing but when I, as the rightful owner, can’t even access my own accounts despite having all the right info, your essentially no better than a hacker locking me out of my accounts.

title: It lost all my information, now I’m locked out of some of my accounts!
text: Awful app, never sync's my info, it just buffers (this has been going on for weeks). It lost all of my codes which I need to use for some accounts that I am now locked out of. I never receive notifications for codes when I should. I can’t even get codes for other accounts I wanted to get codes for! I only got (somehow) two codes for two of my accounts out of a list I want protected. Overall, this app literally does nothing for me, it’s useless and biggest waste of time. 10/10 don’t recommend unless you want your information lost and being locked out of your accounts. Microsoft, why can’t this be better?

title: Does not work with watch; incompetent support
text: While the app works as expected on the phone, it completely fails to work with Apple Watch, although it’s programmed to do it. I installed it on the watch, and it shows the prompt to approve on it, but approving apparently does not make its way back to Microsoft; worse yet, when the watch is showing the prompt, the phone already does not, so in the end nothing works. Even worse, I opened support incident with Microsoft and the rep is completely clueless about Apple Watch and how the Watch works with the phone, and is doing his best to get rid of the problem by telling me to contact Apple Support, among other things.

title: Absolute worst authenticator app
text: This app is less functional than any other authenticator app I have ever used. This app is bugged and doesn’t work at all 95% of the time. You will open the app and it will say it is locked. You are then asked for either touch ID or passcode to unlock the app. After you attempt to unlock by providing touch ID or passcode, the app just closes. It doesn’t allow you to approve any login requests or access your codes. On top of that, this app has never worked with notifications. Any time you try to send a login request to this app it’s supposed to pop up a notification that allows you to quickly open the app and approve the login request. This has never worked.

title: Great app, but missing a key feature.
text: I absolutely love the app but as someone who has NUMEROUS accounts(I’m talking 20+) accounts with two factor authentication, having an outline of a human next to every single one of my accounts except Google and Facebook and Twitter is unacceptable. I have three Outlook accounts and not even those accounts have the Microsoft logo next to them and it is a Microsoft service! I really love this app and really hope to use it again when Microsoft catches up to Authy who has a logo for every single one of my accounts. It makes sorting and finding accounts a million times easier. Adding logos of companies would make this a 5/5 for me. Until then, I’m switching over to Authy.

title: Works ok until you need to recover from a backup
text: Microsoft’s authenticator apps claims to be able to back up your accounts/data to icloud, and that would be a nice feature to have. I made sure my icloud backup was enabled in the authenticator app and then reset my iPhone and restored from a backup. When it came time to open the authenticator app, it had no accounts in there, so I clicked the Restore accounts from backup option, and it claims I have no icloud backup :). So then I get to have the lovely experience of trying to get into all my accounts that have 2 factor authentication enabled without the authenticator app. Super fun, thanks Microsoft! Great app here, if you care about not getting locked out of your accounts, don't use this app! ICLOUD BACKUP DOES NOT WORK.

title: No App Support
text: Been trying to figure out for days why the Authenticator app isn’t notifying me or giving me a passcode to sign me into my account for work. Today after several attempts to troubleshoot and try to find support but failed, I decided to uninstall and reinstall but after several turn off/turn on, try connected to Wi-Fi and not connected, the app simply will not download. There is no app support through Microsoft, Apple won’t let me report the problem as this isn’t a paid app so there is literally no way for me to get help and my job requires this dumb thing or I can’t get access to my work account! So writing here as maybe someone will look into the problem

title: Bad Password Storage
text: Storing passwords using this app is a pain, if you are trying to enter a new password or edit an old password, the keyboard completely covers the place you are writing so you can’t see anything and it is such a small space it’s almost impossible to try to paste a password you have copied into that area. This could be easily fixed if the circle with the website logo didn’t take up half the screen.

title: Does do what its intended to
text: I had to download this app, unwillingly, to verify signing in for a school email account, but have noticed in recent months, the app no longer serves any purpose, when prompted to type a number for verifying my identity, nothing happens, when asked about a pin to type in, same thing,, until they fix it, just verify your email with a phone number, which is annoying because many times my phone isn’t with me, and I have to choose between going to grab it or putting off the task at hand for later. Until they fix it, i’ll probably be uninstalling it.

title: AUTHENTICATION SLAYER
text:
This product is the best authenticator in the business because it keeps all of your authentication methods, codes, and passwords safe and sound.

With that being said, please make sure you always have access to the app and have other ways to get in just in case you get locked out of your phone or your phone gets stolen. As long as you have that set in stone; You should be safe and all of your authenticator purposes will be solved.

title: Makes logging in and phone migration a piece of cake
text:
This app is great. Not only can I get 2FA codes, but the push to login to Outlook is awesome. I no longer use a password. Logging in should always be like this. 

Today, I discovered a new feature, all my codes got automatically migrated when I logged into my outlook account in my new phone. That process used to take five hours setting up a dozen new 2FA codes on all my accounts. 

Thank you Microsoft for solving this use case. Excellent app!

title: Decent app, with one major drawback
text: I use this application regularly, and it’s quite stable. But, the watch notification functionality is very frustrating to use. It works maybe 40-50% of the time, which is a terrible hit rate for a business related application. It usually says “failed to communicate with phone” which is likely due to some power saving feature in iOS killing the Authenticator app process. But in the end, it results in a frustrating user experience. The feature should either be fixed, or removed.

title: Apple Watch functionality is broken
text:
The phone app is reliable and I seem to always get the push notifications when expected. However, a recent update has broken the authentication on Apple Watch. The error is a “failure to communicate” after trying to approve on the watch. This is a “must have”feature, and it’s a disappointing regression. Update: Apple Watch functionality works the first time after a phone restart, and then not again until the next restart. Very frustrating.

Update Feb 25 - can still only approve on the Watch about once per day. After that it’s the same “failure to communicate” error. Very annoying.

title: Restore doesn’t work when backed up to mac
text:
I loved this app until i got a new phone and restored my old phone backup from my mac to my new phone. The 2fa accounts are not backed up. There was also some failure with iCloud backup for this app (probably because you have to enable it in so many places). 

This means i have to send my id to all the companies i used 2fa with to get access to my accounts again.

So, before you lose or replace your iPhone, turn off 2fa on all your accounts or you will be screwed, like me. Get a real authenticator with a company that offers real support or a backup that actually works.

title: Troubleshoot
text:
I was also stuck in this loop where I couldn’t sign in to the authenticator app without the authenticator app(? 
Tedious to deal with but I finally managed to troubleshoot through it. I give this app a 2 star because although I was able to fix my issue, this shouldn’t be an issue to begin with. This is a crucial tool for a lot of people and this needs to be fixed to provide a smooth experience for us, specially when we need it for work/assignments. What is Microsoft doing about this? I see all these negative reviews where people need to sign in and yet NOTHING from the creators.

title: Microsoft Authenticator App stopped opening on my IPhone
text: The Authenticator app has been working flawlessly on my phone since I downloaded it over a year ago, I was on a trip for couple of days and wanted to login to my email account from another IP. I tried to open the app from to authorize my login, but the app close by itself immediately. I’ve restarted my phone several times and tried every other me methods I’ve seen online but none of them has worked so far. I’ll lose access to my account if I delete the app.

title: Great App for authentication
text: I have been using the Microsoft Authentication app for a few years now without any issues. The only problem I have run j to was upgrading my phone and transferring data. The app migrated without any issues, but my accounts I had did not make the move. Had to re-add each one. I can sort of see why we would need to do this, but my Duo Auth app moved my accounts without any issues.

title: Convenience without compromising security
text: Microsoft Authenticator is the best MFA app. Since I use my Microsoft account all the time, having a second factor in authenticating gives me assurance & security. And the way it’s implemented is perfect—it sends me a notification, I select a number that matches with the browser, and scan my fingerprint (Touch ID). Amazing! And I can also add 2FA codes of other apps/sites such as Google & Facebook. The app also has iCloud backup & app lock with a passcode & biometrics.

title: Upset Apple Watch support is going away
text: Being able to use an Apple Watch with Authenticator has been the only tolerable thing about this app, and I’m very annoyed that the watch won’t be compatible any longer. The iPhone app is slow, clunky, and the notifications are often delayed or never come through at all. The watch made all of those issues moot because it always worked, plus I didn’t have to find my phone, unlock my phone, open the app, and hope everything worked. Very very disappointing development. Will definitely negatively impact my work experience. Support for the watch should be continued!

title: Tuff game out here
text: Just saying this app is great but when you delete it accidentally.! Yup me takes forever to recover the accounts added from before.  Wish there was a support system for that cause I even called and waited the time still. Need to get School & Work stuff and the time off line due to this issue pandemic blah rant it’s a great app don’t get me wrong. I’ve been here from 3.1 win days n 3-1/2 diskettes like what 12 or more.?

title: Intrusive and annoying.
text:
First, I was forced to download this app just to get into my own school account. Why do I have to download another app because THEIR security by THEIR OWN standards isn’t good enough? Or at least, why can’t I opt out? I’ll take the risk, it’s MY account.
 
Having to download the app was annoying enough but it FORCES you to have notifications on. Like, it literally would not let me continue without turning them on. I keep my notifications clean but even if I didn’t why do I HAVE to see whatever notifications they decide to send through the app? When I didn’t even want to download it in the first place???

title: Unique feature to backup / restore for iPhone
text: The best app just because it has very helpful feature to backup ALL accounts in iCloud (iPhone only) and restore them all on new iPhone (or after reset). Very useful feature, not supported by any other Authenticator app, ie all other ones require both new AND old phone, but with MS Authenticator you can just restore everything to the new phone from backup !!! High five to MS !!!

title: Horrible
text: I don't use iCloud for anything but my icloud email. When I had an ios uodate 17.0.1 screw up my phone to where I had to factory reset it, I lost the Microsoft authenticator data. My Google Authenticator did not disappear nor did my Adobe one. Only Microsoft Authenticator disappeared and because I don't trust anything with iCloud due to PRISM and apple giving back doors to the government, I have no way to recover my two factor authentication for dozens of accounts so I'm totally screwed thanks to Microsoft's poor programming. And they won't give you any help on the phone and they make you listen to a machine that won't put you through anywhere.

title: Latest version broke the GUI
text:
Come on, Microsoft, have you even used this app on an iPhone or iPad? Your prompt covers the number(s)that we are trying to remember and there is no way to move that. Then you have to cancel the prompt and go through that several times. 

How are we supposed to remember that number? By  some supernatural sense? How hard can it be to design a single prompt so that we can see those numbers? 

I can’t believe how incompetent one has to be to release such dysfunctional version. Last one used to be OK on an iPhone (not iPad). Please, please, take a look at this and correct this awful interface.

title: Takes too much time
text: I have used Duo before which I found to be very smooth. You can sign in using long tap without even opening the app, saving lots of time. With Authenticator you have to open the app and then it takes multiple Face ID scans, sometimes up to 3 times, which doesn’t make sense to me. I reflexively close my phone screen after first Face ID is “checked”, and have to log in again for another Face ID. I think this could be made a lot smoother by Microsoft. It might be more secure than Duo (not sure about that though) but definitely more cumbersome.

title: Decent app, but doesn’t work well with Apple Watch
text:
My organisation made the switch from Symantec VIP Access to Microsoft Authenticator. It works very well on my iPhone but was very limited in its implementation of the notifications on Apple Watch. 

I only installed Symantec VIP Access on my phone and not on the watch but I was able to receive notifications on my watch that allowed me to tap ‘Approve’ without having to pickup my phone. Microsoft Authenticator notifies me on my watch but I can only tap Dismiss. I have to go an extra step to authenticate on my phone which is disruptive to my workflow.

title: Restore never works
text: I’ve had to uninstall this app to re-setup my phone. When logging back in to recover my accounts the app would never actually let me login, instead it prompted me to change my password (in which I then did) and then created a new backup right then and there… even with my iCloud sync on and making sure my recovery account was correct from the last time I had an issue where I had to restore my accounts I’d thought it would save this time around and well it just did not. Now I have to email support to various websites and companies as I’m not able to get into my accounts…

title: Dow the job it needs to do but…
text:
This authenticator app is a must for any of us working in the Microsoft azure space or with a company that has full Microsoft. It is an essential tool and helps keep account secure as expected. 

But I believe I found a bug when this app is open and on screen appears to really heat up my iPhone 12 pro. I have about 16 one time passwords in this app, so I don’t know if it’s related to that, but maybe Microsoft you could look into that

title: App doesn’t even know I’m using it
text: Every time I need to use this truly terrible app, I cringe. It never goes well, not once. But alas, I need to every two months when my company requires I change my password. When the dreaded times come to use this, I constantly have to log in over and over. I need to fully close and then re-launch the app to receive the approval message. This is all to log into Outlook, but despite Outlook prompting me to open the app, it never registers that I’ve successfully authenticated. So, I’m never able to actually do anything. Not sure if Outlook is terrible or this, but either way, I don’t understand why anyone chooses to use Microsoft apps.

title: Great until it wasn’t
text: I’ve been using this app for years, not by choice until recently. I wanted to ditch LastPass so I imported all my passwords into edge, then set Authenticator to sync passwords. This worked flawlessly for a couple weeks. I assume an update killed this. After the autofill failed to work today, I went in the settings and my sync settings were gone. When I click on the link to set it back up, when I click on the MS link to do so, it returns me to the settings page. In effect, there is no longer a way to sync passwords. First they take away some watch support and now this. First rate garbage.

title: The worst yet!
text: This app is not useable because for some reason Microsoft cannot figure out how to allow a user to have an email address that can be securely used if they have an organizational email, such as a university, but are an individual account.  They first forced me to use two-factor authentication which seemed like a great idea, but if you use it, you cannot reset the password for your Xbox without canceling your gaming system and reinstalling it!  It takes you in circles changing your passwords!  It would be great if they could make their system work, but now it is only an illusion!  There is not any person available to tell the problems.

title: App is great but Apple Watch not working
text:
Every time I try using it. It tells me “Get started by adding a personal Microsoft account on the phone app”. A what the hell does that even mean? I have a Microsoft account (MSN on iPhone accounts) have the authenticator app and it generates codes fine. Also added my MSN account on my Apple Watch. Deleted the app on the watch. Restarted phone. Installed again and still the same message. 

What the hell is the “phone app”? If that means the Watch App on the iPhone then yes I added my MSN there...

title: Use Google authenticator instead
text:
I had to downgrade my phone from iOS 15 to 14 which involved me doing a reset 
Upon reinstalling this app the only accounts which were recovered were my Microsoft account. So now I have to remove 2FA from all the other accounts and set it up again, for some accounts (eg GeForce now) there is no option to login without the 2FA app so I’m locked out of some accounts as well now.
Google authenticator had all the accounts saved and was ready to go. Just don’t use this app because if you ever need to reinstall this app it won’t have any other logins except the Microsoft account.

title: Great, But it has a security flaw
text:
I have activated the notification of the app so I can see sign-in requests, I have also activated the app lock mechanism so no one could see my codes.
But when I get a notification and I tap on it, the app opens locked but it shows me a request that says "approve sign-in?". Anyone with access to my phone can approve it.

Sorry to post here but I couldn't find contact info of developers of this app on Microsoft website , I can provide Screenshot if needed.

title: New problems?
text:
After the recent update, I’m finding that any attempts to add mfa for an email that’s already inside of the Authenticator for a different site, it wants to wipe the one already saved, instead of adding it as an additional mfa account like it should be. As an MSP that is onboarding new clients with multiple sites using the same account, this is a major problem. As it stands, we have to use a different Authenticator at this point just to access all of the accounts we manage.

Great for personal use, but for professional use, I’m having a hard time recommending this as it stands.

title: Was working smoothly until…
text: I’ve been using the app fine for a while, but this problem has been getting so awful and makes outlook UNUSABLE. I need my Authenticator app to sign into outlook on my mobile app/web browser, but I get directed to sign into my email IN the AUTHENTICATOR app. Then the Authenticator app asks me to approve the sign-in on the AUTHENTICATOR APP. I need the app to sign into the app!!! I’ve been circling through this like crazy all evening, and this isn’t the first time this has happened. Please just let me use my mobile phone number for 2-factor authentication instead of using a perpetually buggy app.
